title: Pep Guardiola claims gap between Manchester City and Chelsea is still "too big" as his side thump West Ham

Pep Guardiola believes the gap between Manchester City and Chelsea is still "too big", dismissing his side's chances of catching the Premier League leaders. 
The Spaniard made his comments following the Citizens' 4-0 win over West Ham at the London Stadium, when asked on BT Sport whether he feels the Blues are within City's reach. 
Guardiola previously claimed Antonio Conte's men were too far ahead of the rest of the chasing pack, and ultimately it is their title to lose. 
And it appears he is sticking by his comment, despite a very convincing win over the Hammers, in which new signing Gabriel Jesus stole the show. Pep Guardiola still doesn't think his Man City side can catch Chelsea (Photo: AFP) Antonio Conte's men are nine points clear at the top of the Premier League (Photo: Getty) 
Speaking after the game, which you can see in the above video, Guardiola says: "The gap is too big, just Chelsea can lose the Premier League. 
"But we'll be in it until the last day fighting for a qualifier for the Champions League, but all the teams are so strong. 
"Tottenham, Arsenal and [Man] United. All of them are so dangerous, but we want to be there with them, of course." 
Kevin de Bruyne broke the deadline for Guardiola's men at the London Stadium on Wednesday evening, slotting past Darren Randolph in 17 minutes. Kevin De Bruyne scored the Citizens' first goal in their 4-0 win over West Ham (Photo: REUTERS) Jesus scored and bagged an assist in his third appearance for City at London Stadium (Photo: REUTERS) 
David Silva made it two four minutes later before the 19-year-old Brazilian notched his first goal for City, in just his third appearance in a sky blue shirt. 
Yaya Toure converted a penalty after the break to make it four in a game City dominated from the first whistle to the very last.
